Reviews.Title: “St. Patrick's Day Weeend”
Reviews.Author: Danham13
Reviews.Content: We made our reservation through Hotels.com, which was cheaper at the time versus Starwood. I made reservations for 4 rooms for 3 family members and my sister-in-law. The Sheraton at Keystone Crossing was located near the church and reception for my son's wedding. The hotel was comfortable, clean, had a coffee cafe, and specials on breakfast and lunch. I had to cancel my sister-in-law's reservation, which had a cancellation penalty. I contacted Hotels.com and talked to a supervisor, Charles, and he clarified the cancellation policy, but refunded the entire reservation; I thanked him for his generosity. There are several restaurants in the immediate area for lunch or dinner. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Business mixed with pleasure trip!”
Reviews.Author: Toledobabs
Reviews.Content: I would recommend the Sheraton at Keystone to anybody looking for a great hotel in the area! The front desk went out of their way to make us have a great stay! I loved the skywalk to the Fashion Mall~easy access to shopping! The bed was heavenly, spacious bathroom and clean room. The lobby bar was also a nice plus~ We will defineatly stay her again!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: traveling_CA_mommy
Reviews.Content: We got an incredible rate for this hotel via priceline.com. The rooms were clean. The beds were small, but comfortable. We liked that the mall was connected to the mall which made it convenient when we went shopping. The workout room was nice. They had a good variety of cardio and strength training equipment. It was conveniently located to the freeway so that made getting to different parts of two easy. The downside was that there is no free wifi in the rooms. Even motels offer free wifi. There is wifi in the lobby, but it's still a drag. Overall,I would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “The front desk was very helpful!”
Reviews.Author: cfpd11
Reviews.Content: My family needed a weekend out of the house from the winter blues. With all the hotels in the indy area it was hard to pick one. Knowing the Sheraton brand wouldn't let us down we picked Sheraton hotel at Keystone and the crossing. The hotel was great from the front doors to are bed. The room was very clean and fit all of are needs. What topped the stay off was the front desk. (Megan) From checking in to checking out she was always nice and very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Several aspects of hotel worn and aging.”
Reviews.Author: Pippa13
Reviews.Content: This hotel has many of the great aspects of the usual Sheraton hotels - convenient newer computers in the lobby, large rooms, comfortable beds, clean/newish bed linens, large TV, etc. However, we were surprised at the condition of the room doors (deep scratches, chips) and the elevators which looked very worn and an overall aging atmosphere in the hallways and the bathrooms. It has skywalks to the Fashion Mall at Keystone Crossing which is very convenient. Easy walking distance to Starbucks and restaurants - PF Changs, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Sheraton renovation done right!”
Reviews.Author: ClevelandConrads
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a great new vibe. Inviting lobby and bar with race themed rooms including elegant furniture and furnishing with a really unique carpet. Yes, even a very comfortable bed. We enjoined our stay on Race Weekend and plan to return to this location. One note of clarification to ease your stay: if you park in the garage and take the sky bridge on the 3rd floor to the hotel you enter the hotel on the 2nd floor.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay”
Reviews.Author: RJerkinson
Reviews.Content: I stayed a few weekends ago with my family and we all had a great time. I have stayed at this hotel in the past, but have never upgraded to a club room. I would recommend that everyone upgrade. Allison in the club was thoughtful and great with my kids. She also told me about some of the better restaurants in the area to take the family. The rooms were very modern, clean, and comfortable. Plus the front desk staff was fast at check-in and got us right to our room which was much needed because we were all very tired. My overall experience was great and will be staying again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but some of the staff were not helpful.”
Reviews.Author: legaleagle76_10
Reviews.Content: First, I must say that the hotel is great--the staff, not so much. Arrived late on a Thursday night with a vehicle full of kids and luggage. Received absolutely no help from the bell staff with bags. Then I went to the desk to check-in and the hostess was on her cell phone, talking with her boyfriend and they appeared to be fighting. She was more interested in that conversation than checking me in. Finally, a co-worker stepped up and finished the job. When we returned the next evening, none of our key cards would work. My daughter went to the front desk and tried to secure new cards, but was told all they had to do was re-key them, that did not work, and after three attempts, they finally gave us new cards, which worked fine. The room was very clean and the beds were heaven after a long day on our feet. Housekeeping was good and responded to our every request. I guess I would say, just don't expect much from the front desk and your stay will be fine. (Oh, and internet in the room is not free, you have to go to the front lobby for internet access.)

Reviews.Title: “Laura”
Reviews.Author: LAURA G
Reviews.Content: Our daughter recently started attending college at UIndy, and we are from California. We chose this Sheraton initially because we are Starwood Preferred members, and because they did not charge for parking like the downtown Sheraton which is closer. I just could not justify paying $25 per day to park a rental car when I can drive 10 extra miles. We have since stayed there on 4 different trips and it has been a pleasurable experience each time! Clean, well kept rooms. Nice workout facilty, adjacent to a nice mall with lots of food choices and free parking!! On my last trip in Jan 2012, a new feature was added that I love!! Go green choice to not have your room made up each day and receive either a $5 gift cert to use during your stay (per day) or 500 star points (per day) back to your account was a fantastic idea!! Final bonus, the staff (especially Megan at the front desk) weere always helpful, and Megan even remembered me from my previous stays!! My choice every time when I go to Indianapolis!!

Reviews.Title: “Handicap room small but well maintained”
Reviews.Author: eciba
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the 10th floor handicap room. It was at the far end of a long hallway and in a corner. It was hard to use a wheelchair in the room. The room was clean and well maintained.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: raghag
Reviews.Content: This is a lovely property. It is very clean and the staff is very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Customer Service!”
Reviews.Author: Sam F
Reviews.Content: We stayed here last week, and being a bit hurried, we lost some very important items. With the help of the staff, especially LaVerne, we managed to find our items. I'd recommend this hotel at any time for anyone! Thanks LaVerne.

Reviews.Title: “Second home”
Reviews.Author: Kevin M
Reviews.Content: I stayed here at Keystone almost every week for a year. Being on the road so much can be difficult, but this was made easier by the friendliness of the staff here. They went out of their way each and every week to ensure I felt welcome. I knew almost all of the staff by first name, and they would say hello from across the lobby if they saw me. Megan and Allison were two exceptional employees, as well as Tanya, the lounge crew, and the restaurant/starbucks ladies. If you're ever in the Indianapolis area, I'd strongly recommend this hotel. It was always clean, excellent service, and a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Nicely remodeled. Great location attached to The Fashion Mall!”
Reviews.Author: tbowes
Reviews.Content: We were very pleasantly surprised how nicely the hotel had been remodeled. The Guest rooms are very contemporary and the bathrooms are nice sized and updated. The staff was all very friendly as of assistance with all of our needs. Very nice lobby bar. We were in Indy to finish some last minute Christmas Shopping, and actually ended up using the very convenient computers in the lobby to do some online shopping as well! Would stay here again anytime.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: kcj1314
Reviews.Content: Above and beyond my expectations. The staff went out of their way to help when my entire family got sick with the stomach flu. They also allowed very late checkout so my son could rest. The hotel is very clean and updated and the beds are very comfy. I never had the chance to eat any food or see the pool but will be back for sure. Thank you to the staff and will recommend

Reviews.Title: “AWESOME EXPERIENCE”
Reviews.Author: PhiBlu
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Sheraton at the Keystone crossing every week for almost a year and all I can say is that my experience was nothing short of awesome. It was like my second home and I received excellent service each and every time. The employees were always on point in making sure my every stay was comfortable as can be. Allison and Megan Lancaster were very exceptional in providing everything I needed both at the club lounge and at the front desk. I recommend you ask for any of these two when you check in at this property. The rooms were also very nice. I have stayed at many hotels (nature of my job) and yet, this property still holds a very high rank in terms of the "home feel" the rooms gave me.

Reviews.Title: “reviewit”
Reviews.Author: darryl b
Reviews.Content: The sheraton indianapolis at keystone Crossing has really upgraded to a higher level of quality. We stayed on the club floor and we had a corner suite, it was wonderful. The bed was just comfortable, I looked to see what type of mattress, it was so soft. I am going to buy a mattress just like that one, if possible. The hotel improvements were extremely modern. I love the computers in the lobby, and you don't have to search for the business center

Reviews.Title: “Great stay, would go back”
Reviews.Author: claybrizendine
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this Sheraton with my family (wife, 7 yr old, 6 yr old) on a Tuesday night just as a stay-over in between seeing other family during the holidays. I had requested via my SPG points a Club Room for a total of 5,000 points. It was hard to find the main entrance due to construction with no signs pointing you toward the main doors. I went in the conference center doors and walked my way to the lobby desk. They informed me right away that the Club lounge would not be open, but instead I could redeem vouchers in the restaurant for the nightly appetizers and morning breakfast that I would have gotten in the lounge. The room was decent sized, and the bathroom was oversized with a standing shower with no tub. I also loved that they recycled. The view from the room looked down onto the connected mall, but that was OK. I redeemed our vouchers that night and the next morning for the meals that we wanted, and while the service was definitely slow, the people were nice - they were just understaffed. All in all, a good stay, and I would go back.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient and Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: ChrisV8
Reviews.Content: The Sheraton Indianapolis at Keystone Crossing has recently undergone a total makeover. We have always loved this hotel when staying in Indy because it has a very convenient location equidistant to both the airport and downtown and with in a stone's throw of two of our favorite shopping malls- The Fashion Mall and Castleton Mall. In fact, there is direct entrance into the Fashion Mall from the second floor of the hotel. It couldn't be anymore convenient! The hotel is easily accessible from five interstates (I-70, I-465, I-65, I-69 and I-74). The rooms are spacious and the decor is modern and appealing. The beds are extraordinarily comfortable and the baths are separated from the sleeping areas by a walled hallway for more privacy. There is an awesome fitness center on the property,as well as a large indoor swimming pool and 20 person hot tub. The restaurant is small but since the hotel is surrounded by more than 20 fantastic eateries like Sullivan's Steak House, PF Chang's, Patachou's, Cheesecake Factory& Benihana's (just to name a few) most hotel guest eat elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel, but could use a better cleaning”
Reviews.Author: Jamiebean80
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at this hotel Saturday December 17th 2011. We were going to a holiday party in Carmel, IN and I wanted to shop at the Fashion Mall. This hotel is a huge hotel, free parking, connected to the mall even. So super great location. The front entry way is under construction, but hardly an issue, since we used the garage. Upon check in at 5pm or so local time, we were helped by a tall blonde man. VERY VERY nice guy, very social, quick and just really welcoming. I was very pleased by this. Our room was on the 12th floor, fantastic room, great view, wonderful bed, but the shower was pretty gross. There were little hairs stuck in the shower curtain, stuck on the walls and it appeared that someone had blown their nose on the wall of the shower. It was pretty gross. Other than the shower, I'd say this hotel was great. I would've given five starts if it weren't for the shower. We also ate breakfast the next morning (1030am or so) at the buffet. Great food, but the staff wasn't that great. We waited a good 7-8 minutes to even be acknowledged by the person who was to seat us.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel and location!”
Reviews.Author: msditty
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay here! The rooms were recently remodeled and the beds were amazingly comfortable! There is a bar onsite and we did enjoy some cocktails but it was pricey! They also serve food here, They do have a pool and gym but we didnt use these facilities. This hotel is attached the Keystone Fashion Mall so it was nice to be able to walk to the mall for Christmas shopping! We went for a corporate Christmas Party and the banquet facilites and food was good! The staff was helpful and friendly! THe elevators were extremely slow and do not pay the $18 for valet service, which we did. You drive around the corner to the covered garage and it is FREE! Valet costs and your car is parked outside!

Reviews.Title: “Great for business travel”
Reviews.Author: BK_Traveling_Chica
Reviews.Content: I stay at this hotel every week, Mon thru Thurs. I love the comfort of the rooms and the service I receive from the staff. In particular Paulette is always quite helpful in the morning with requests before greeting me with a friendly "have a great day!" as I head out the door. The hotel is great with receiving packages and holding luggage, etc (you won't believe the problems I've had at other hotels). The hotel is recently renovated, meaning up to date rooms. The housekeeping staff always does a superb job, which isn't always the case even at the fanciest of hotels. A skyway bridge connects the hotel to the mall/Cheesecake Factory. There is plenty of free parking in the attached garage. I don't recommend the room service. There are far better more cost effective options closer.They've recently completed parking construction so all the comments below don't apply. Overall I like this hotel and will continue to choose this one over others in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Sheraton, Indianapolis IN”
Reviews.Author: Nathan E
Reviews.Content: This hotel and staff was very fast and friendly. The hotel was very clean with plenty of actives to do for the kids.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service and Convenient Location”
Reviews.Author: Forpetessake973
Reviews.Content: I am a business traveler that stays at this hotel approximately 8-10 nights per month. This hotel consistently provides great service and I want to recognize a desk employee - Paulette who always is very helpful. The location is at Keystone Crossing with a skyway to good shopping and restaurants. Covered free ramp parking is another plus.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place, great service, Club Lounge well done”
Reviews.Author: KiowaVT
Reviews.Content: I was helped out, treated well, great room, great club lounge. Fitness center the best on my trip, and full when I went but plenty of room for me to work my way in.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: ckgosch
Reviews.Content: We had a nice stay here in October. The location is great, about a 5 minute drive from Broadripple. Rooms seemed to be recently updated and are really nice. Onsite parking was free and easy to get to. Right next to the Fashion Mall so great for a shopping weekend. We will be back.

Reviews.Title: “It's my second home”
Reviews.Author: NicNic430
Reviews.Content: Paulette who is a manager at the hotel is awesome! She is one of the reasons why I remain a guest at the hotel. I bascially live in this hotel Monday through Thursday every week since April of this year. The rooms are clean, the staff is friendly and flexible and it's a great location connected to the Fashion Mall.

Reviews.Title: “Excellant Hotel Stay and Staff”
Reviews.Author: R S
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at this hotel and was very pleased with my stay. The club lounge is the only lounge that I have been to that stays open on the weekends, which was very convenient for me since I was there on a Friday. Allison in the lounge was very pleasant and helped with all request including a reservation at Cheesecake Factory. The room was very comfortable and modern. The staff at the front desk was also very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT STAY!!”
Reviews.Author: kevo2455
Reviews.Content: Pleasant stay, Meagan from guest services was great, please promote!!

Reviews.Title: “WHAT AN ABSOLUTELY FANTASTIC PLACE!!!”
Reviews.Author: MsG4611
Reviews.Content: We had our daughter's wedding reception here. I have never seen a staff work so hard to make everything perfect and it was. The parking valet, front desk, bellmans, wait staff, admins, all of them. They were all super helpful. Little things that we forgot or didn't think of, they jumped in and took care of it, without us having to ask or even think about it. The food and service were first class, AAAA+ excellent. Ronda Strykowsky, the sales/banquet manager, is the nicest, friendliest, most knowledgeable and well informed person I have ever had the privilege of working with. She handled every one of my concerns and made sure we got everything we wanted. Practically the entire hotel had been remodeled, lobby, pool, fitness center, rooms and all. Yet, we were still given the cheapest wedding block rate I have ever seen, especially for a full service, luxury hotel. They provide a huge parking garage for free. Indoor access to the garage and the fashion mall. We ate breakfast, lunch and dinner there. All were supreme. You just won't find a better place to go. I just wish I had more daughters. They would all be having their reception at the Sheraton @ Keystone Crossing.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful!”
Reviews.Author: moe_moe_0069
Reviews.Content: This hotel is really beautiful. My only complaint is the little extras. This hotel is a 4 star hotel but you have to pay extra for your wifi internet and extra for breakfast. I have stayed at a 3 star hotel and it had those things included. Also there was a bottle of water in the room that costs $3.95... The people were very nice but all you get with the price is the room. We booked it on hotwire.com, without the name being shown for $76 a night. That's pretty amazing for a 4 star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Doesn't happen every day...”
Reviews.Author: Nagz
Reviews.Content: I am currently a guest in this hotel. Yesterday, while walking to the elevator, a bank envelope with hundreds of dollars in cash, along with a check, fell from my purse onto the hallway floor. I was completely unaware of this, until I arrived at my destination that evening, only to find the money gone - ALL of the cash I had at the time. I knew what had happened... I have a lousy purse. I immediately figured the money was lost for good. I mean, who turns hundreds of dollars in cash into lost and found? Sylvia Mendez, a stellar employee of the Sheraton at Keystone Crossing. Upon my return last evening, the message light was flashing on my phone. Rachel Miller, the night manager on duty, had left a message telling me someone had turned in a "lost and found" item, and to please return her call. Instantly, I thought "impossible.., no way." When I called Rachel, she politely asked me a series of questions to assure the lost "item" indeed belonged to me. Honestly, I'm still dumbstruck by the entire thing. A person who turns in cash is, without question, someone with incredible integrity. Sylvia is a true credit to the Sheraton corporation and is to be commended in the highest possible way. Thankfully, I also got the opportunity to meet her later that evening when she delivered my room service order. She is a perfectly delightful lady; professional and very, very warm and polite. Again, a true credit to the company. As to the hotel facilities... I've found the rooms to be completely comfortable, attractive and well-appointed. The beds are VERY comfortable. As a fitness buff, something very important to me is exercise facilities. The one here is among the best I've ever experienced anywhere. Nice number of machines, roomy, good temp. A+. The connected shopping mall with Saks and other top-name stores is just the icing on the cake. I'll definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “Outdated, but excellent service”
Reviews.Author: scootiequeen
Reviews.Content: The Sheraton at Keystone at the Crossing was a little dated, but the service at the front desk was excellent. The room was clean and the beds were very comfortable. The room layout made it difficult to maneuver. When you walk into the room, there is a wall right in front of you. The bathroom, although clean, was tiny. We got this room through Priceline so we got a great deal. If we would have paid full price, I would not have been happy. Parking is across the street (free), but they were doing construction on the sidewalks and any handicapped people (me) had to wheel on the street during busy traffic. That's an accident waiting to happen. They should use some of their valet spots for handicapped parking while construction is happening.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel for shopping but not to visit downtown Indy. What is that smell?”
Reviews.Author: TNT14
Reviews.Content: Arrived at hotel after 10 hour drive. The lobby is great with plenty of areas to hang out and lots of computers with free internet. Went to desk and the front desk agent was not very personable. If I can come in with a smile and try to strike a conversation after 10 hours of driving the least he can do is be pleasant. After living in the south for 14 years I never understood the term "southern charm" as many people are transplants. But after a couple days in the Midwest I miss some of the kindness that I guess I have taken for granted. 6 days to go on our trip so hopefully our luck will change in Chicago. Anyway back to the hotel. The front desk person didn't speak much and usually they like to explain all the hotel has to offer (heated pool, fitness area, connected to a mall) but it seems he didn't feel the need to do that. Had a room on 4th floor and the elevator and 4th floor both smelled like vomit. When we mentioned it the next day it was met with that noone else mentioned it. How about coming with us and seeing if we might just be crazy but when my own kids are covering their noses we knew were sane. The rooms were nice and met our needs. Having used priceline we could not complain. Parking was free which is a huge plus.The surrounding area is nice with lots of shopping and lots of big name chain restaurants (good small local breakfast one next to hotel called Patachou). Indy is comprised of some nice neighborhoods and areas to visit (Broad Ripple, Massachusetts Ave, Zoo and White River Park area) but they are all incovenient to get to. A 10 mile drive takes 30 minutes. So if you are here to visit the town best bet is stay downtown. If you want to shop stay here at this hotel and maybe arrive earlier in the day for better service.

Reviews.Title: “Well Acquainted with the Hotel”
Reviews.Author: kkaymorgan
Reviews.Content: I live in Indy and work for a large company that frequently books overnight and meeting rooms at the Sheraton at Keystone Crossing. I have personally stayed there several times and have toured the recently renovated rooms. I would not hesitate to recommend this property to any traveler - business or family. You will feel safe, enjoy a lovely room, and have access to many great restaurant, entertainment, and shopping venues. The staff is wonderful, food is great, and the location is perfect. If you are traveling with children they will love the pool and shopping mall, which you can access via an enclosed walkway. Nearby restaurants include Sullivans (upscale steakhouse), Maggianos (great Italian) and Cheesecake Factory. Please feel free to contact me for any specific questions.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in good location (but definitely not downtown Indy)”
Reviews.Author: DCircus
Reviews.Content: Thankfully, we booked several months before Gencon because the Sheraton was booked solid. I could tell they were crazy busy the first night. Loved that the hotel is attached to the mall. One day, we even stayed on site to check it all out. Great restaurants, nice shopping, great kicking back. With Hotwire, only $65/night. Sweet deal. The only drawback, though, was I reserved for 3 adults and a child and the room we had had a king bed and pull out sofa. Thankfully, we had reserved another room for the successive nights. It was identical. It was definitely more appropriate for 2 people.

Reviews.Title: “There was no running water.”
Reviews.Author: Amybeth36
Reviews.Content: They did a scheduled shutoff of the water to work on something WHILE there were guests in the hotel--which blows my mind---but they didnt tell us when we checked in!! My husband was late for a very important meeting, and he had to wash his hair with an ice cold bottle of water. When we asked about it, there was no apology, just that we could ho to a nearby lifetime fitness to shower if we wanted. The kicker was, after my husband left, I called and placed a room service order, cold items, because they couldn't cook anything. 25 minutes laster someone called me back and told me ghey wouldnt be bringing it because they couldn't wash their hands. My husband is in the restaurant business and he is opening a restaurant here, and bringing a lot of hotel business with him. Sadly, sheraton won't be getting it. Mistakes happen, I understand that, but how they are dealt with is what separates average businesses from great ones.

Reviews.Title: “Mostly good!”
Reviews.Author: BobSouthBend_IN
Reviews.Content: My Wife and I stayed here for a weekend away. It is a very noisy and crowed hotel. It is very nice though. There was a junior tennis tournament going on in Indy and because of it there were kids everywhere. They were laying on the floor in the lobby watching tv and running all over the place. Bad timing. We had one issue getting our room cleaned the first day and had to come back several times while the maids kept saying 20 minutes. We will be traveling alot to Indy over the next 4 years because of a daughter in college and am not sure if we will pick this particular Sheraton again.

Reviews.Title: “Very convenient location”
Reviews.Author: markristin
Reviews.Content: The hotel was under construction, and not very updated. The parking was very convenient and free. The hotel is connected to a very nice mall, and is located near many restaurant choices.

Reviews.Title: “Stay here”
Reviews.Author: kindhoosier
Reviews.Content: This review will be short and sweet. It's not the newest hotel around but it's location could not be better. Rooms are well maintained and clean. I wouldn't tell someone to book their summer vacation here, but if you need a place to stay on the north side of Indy you really can't go wrong with this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Stay there all the time. Nice rooms and good service”
Reviews.Author: egellman
Reviews.Content: Great place. Nice bar, nice gym and pool and the rooms are comfortable. Good location, tons of restaurants and shopping in walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Not as bad as people make it out to be.”
Reviews.Author: dedjer
Reviews.Content: Aside from the foul stench in the lobby, the rooms were really clean, had a nice HDTV, clean remodeled bathroom with a working fan, great water pressure with plenty of hot water, garage parking, and to top it off the hotel was connected to a very nice, clean shopping mall. Pros: Clean room, clean bathroom, great water pressure, comfy beds, pool, workout facility, covered parking, and connected to a shopping mall. Cons: Wireless costs approx. $10/night so I had to tether my laptop and iPad to my phone for free internet, smelly hallways, food is super expensive something like $10 for a bowl of oatmeal. really?! c'mon!

Reviews.Title: “Needs another renovation”
Reviews.Author: Disapp0inted14
Reviews.Content: Very disappointed with the quality of this hotel in such an exclusive suburban Indianapolis area. Visited this hotel for a very prominent convention and had to relocate to the downtown area after one night's stay. The bedspread was soiled and the bathrooms were outdated. The fan was especially annoying. The best thing about the hotel is that it is conveniently located to the best of shopping and restaurants...More importantly, an onsite Starbucks (if it's open). Now I understand why I received such a reasonable rate. If you are are looking for a 5 star hotel, this is not the 1. I would strongly suggest another renovation.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for meetings!”
Reviews.Author: slmplanner
Reviews.Content: I recently worked at the Sheraton Indianapolis. I am a trip director and work in many hotels every year. Hollis Brown, Meetings Concierge, was a dream! She was available for anything we needed and always had a smile on her face. She offered to go above and beyond and did so throughout our program. I wish I could clone her and take her on the road with me. She knew what we wanted before we did. She made our lives much easier.

Reviews.Title: “some good, some annoying”
Reviews.Author: Nemokota
Reviews.Content: The Good: nice lobby, small Starbucks in lobby, free garage parking, close to shopping and restaurants The Annoying: the hall smelled really bad in the evening. In the morning it only smelled by the elevators, I could not get my room cool enough - felt humid all night. TV could not get any digital channels so I could not watch Showtime, CNN, NBC, etc. Possibly this was due to storms? No towel rack for hand towel. One bath towel was folded and looked clean but was damp (that was a first!). The rest: Ordered room service which came quickly, and was hot and good. Ordered drink with dinner and it came with "low shelf" alcohol though I had mentioned the brand I wanted. My room was ok size, nice view, comfortable bed, pretty good shower head. The Club Lounge was nicely furnished and had some counters where you could sit and get an awesome view. Not nearly as well stocked as other Sheraton Club Lounges I've been in but can't complain since it was free. Reception staff was very friendly. Nice decor. I have been noticing the photographs in Sheratons. They are black and white photos with a local theme. Here it was race car themed- almost abstract. Hard to describe but very artful.

Reviews.Title: “Blah”
Reviews.Author: pgsanjay
Reviews.Content: Pros: got a good deal on priceline. Great bed. Nice flat screen tv. Nice lobby and bar area. Lots of nearby shopping and restaurants Cons: smelly hallways. Poor selection of channels on tv I asked for an extra hour before checkout to shower aster my marathon, and was refused.

Reviews.Title: “Beware of the "Upgrade"”
Reviews.Author: mikeyinmke
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel last minute through Priceline at a great rate. My wife and I arrived very late on a night in early May - after 1am - due to a long drive from Tennessee on our way home. When checking in, the lobby is amazing. Shiny, new, modern. Good feelings happening. The guy running the front desk, I think his name tag said he was the front desk leader/supervisor to that effect told us he "upgraded" us to a suite. Our suite was located in the 2nd tower, the tower the lobby is not located in. As we were dragging our luggage clear across town to get to the other tower, we noticed the change in decor. Gone was the shiny modern look and in came an average, somewhat dated looking atmosphere. When we got to our room, we could see that it was technically a suite, however, this tower was apparantly not part of the "$17 million renovation" the hotel boasts on its website. This room was tired. Old worn-out 1980's furniture, CRT televisions - heck, even the mini-fridge had fake wood paneling on the front. Now you know you haven't seen that since 1987! Now I will concede that the room was spacious and clean, which says a lot when you are going for the cheap. There was a living room, which included a sofa, some chairs, a desk, and a bar area with bar sink and the mini-fridge. The bed was in a separate bedroom and was comfortable. I was a bit worried the bed was as old as everything else, but it seemed the mattress had to have been replaced at some point. The room was cold so we had to turn on the heat in the bedroom, which smelled for awhile. Maybe it hadn't been used recently. Perhaps they reserve these rooms for people who Priceline a 3.5 star hotel at the last minute for $60 a night. But this really feels like two different hotels - one 3.5 stars and one 2.5 stars. If you find yourself booked in this hotel, whether by choice or by chance, do yourself a favor and turn down the "upgrade" and specifically ask for a remodeled non-upgraded room. Hopefully you'll be luckier than we were. Parking is free in a garage next door, but is is no where near the front desk for checking in and out. Wi-fi in the room is not free, but there are nice computers you can use in the lobby for free. Overall grade: C (Might have been an A if we had a renovated room, but had to deduct for the outdated everything and that they charge for wi-fi.)

Reviews.Title: “Needs improvement in service!”
Reviews.Author: Wheda
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 2 nights (May 29 & 30, 2011). We came in to a room with pubic hairs in the tub and trash on the floor from the previous guest and found a spider IN my bed! We ordered room service for dinner and despite their 30 minute guarantee, 3 phone calls and 75 minutes later, still no food so we cancelled the order and went out! The next day, we had to call to get housekeeping because they never showed up. When they finally came, the coffee filters were not emptied, they didn't give us more coffee and they didn't give us enough towels and wash cloths. It's a great location, but their service and management needs A LOT of work to be able to proudy carry the Sheraton name!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Comfortable Rooms”
Reviews.Author: mpaulet
Reviews.Content: The rooms are spacious and the bed is most comfortable. The location is ideal being right at Keystone at the Crossing and therefore convenient to most of northern Indianapolis. The hotel has an indoor pool, whirpool and sun deck which were all very nice. There is free parking if one does not choose to utilize the valet service. The staff was courteous and helpful. I got a deal on Hotwire for this room that could not be beat. There are only two reasons that I did not give the hotel five stars is that they charge for internet service in your room and more importantly the room does not have a self-contained air conditioning unit. The air conditioning unit was one of those central air deals with a supposed thermostat which allows only for minimal control of room temperature. Overall though, it was a great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Remodel”
Reviews.Author: hoosiertreker
Reviews.Content: I live in the area, but use this hotel for out of town guests. This was my first visit since the remodel. THe lobby is beautiful with an area to watch TV, a place to chat with friends in comfort and fairly large cyber lounge area with about eight computers. It's all stylish. The room was very spacious with an attractive couch, Indy 500 themed art and a very comfortable bed. The staff was helpful and the pool area and gym were fresh and clean.

Reviews.Title: “I Had No Choice”
Reviews.Author: suefromCalif
Reviews.Content: As this was a business trip, I had no choice as to my choice of hotels. This hotel was being remodeled, so the restaurant had been relocated to a conference room. We arrived in the evening and ate at the restraraunt. Before we could even sit down, the waitress wanted to know what we wanted to drink. I asked for a few moments to look at the menu and she was a bit upset. The bed was so soft that we had to complain. They brought up a board to fit under the mattress which did help. We ate at a restaurant in the area and was told by the waiter that the hotel shuttle bus could be called to pick us up. The hotel never mentioned that it had this service. To get to the restaurant we had to wade through snow drifts and cross a very busy intersection. The breakfast was paid for by the company giving the seminar but after the fifth day of the same food I decided to ask for a waffle. The waitress went into the kitchen and came back to tell me that the chef said NO. The room itself was large, with a separate sitting area. The hotel is attached to a mall and there are some restaurants both in the mall and in the parking lot. Also this hotel is many miles from downtown Indianapolis and a taxi is quite expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Nightmare at the Sheraton Keystone at the Crossing”
Reviews.Author: travelforbiz50
Reviews.Content: Checked in 4pm, all was good, ineternet kept shutting down, dealt with that. 9:15pm, water was shut off, totally. Not a drop of water all night or next morning. Paid through priceline so no sympathy offered, deal with Priceline I was told since it was not something they could fix. Got in my car, stopped to get gas, realized my rear window in my suv was busted, looked like they failed at getting in but damaged hinge and window. Called hotel and explained..I was told someone would return my call, it didn't happen, tried again and same thing, no one called. Not thrie problem either evidently. Could have been a lot worse had I been walking out at that time. This is an upscale neighborhood but not so safe. Please beware.

Reviews.Title: “Outdated inn with a staff that excels in pettiness and misimformation”
Reviews.Author: fancode
Reviews.Content: To say this place had its time a few decades back would be praise it doesn't deserve. My 'upgrade' was to a suite that couldn't have been further from any of the hotel amenities one would be expect to use. The walls are paper thin and the van driver chastised me for leaving my car out front for more than 10 minutes and threatened he would have my room charged if I did it again. The parking is literally 200 yards from the front desk, and the elevator lobby was another 100 yards further, which made a round trip close 20 minutes of hoofing. The Platinum lounge was closed, and all I received in compensation was a coupon for two drinks, big whoop. When I commented to the front desk clerk that nothing to snack on was available, she said she thought the bar would have something, but wasn't sure. The bartender was nice enough, but unsure why the desk staff thought snacks were provided there. Seemingly a conspiracy of cluelessness was at work, but I was too confused by the disappearing bellman to notice until it was too late, meaning I carried my own bags up to the room as he hurried off in retreat the minute he say he might be of some use. Upon checkout, the van driver once again informed me that my car could not stay in front while I gathered my family, and I should put it back in the distant lot, or pay a valet fee to park in the empty valet lot for 20 minutes. Apparently his duties as a van driver entitled him to also act as parking enforcer, and he did with all the charm he could muster and still be a complete jerk. Overall, shabby treatment for a Platinum guest, so I'd hate to see how they treat people who aren't particularly brand loyal. If you have to stay here for the location, so be it, but I don't wonder why this place gets such poor reviews; it is old and poorly staffed.

Reviews.Title: “home away from home”
Reviews.Author: rrenner
Reviews.Content: From the moment we arrived I could tell that we were in great hands. We were in town for an unfortunate event when my brother in law had a stroke. While most of our time was spent in ICU during the day, we ended each day in the caring arms of the Sheraton staff. We shared our purpose for the trip with an employee (don't even remember who) but from that point forward, everyone that we came in contact with reassured us that anything they could do to help us would be done, and they did! Although the hotel is under renovation and we stayed during an ice/snow storm we never felt like we were inconvenienced or put out. The pool was a great escape for the grandchildren as well. When renovation is complete they will have the full package! When travelling to Indianapolis in the future there is no other choice for us. Thanks!

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced.... Outdated....disapointment”
Reviews.Author: cropguy
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a conference Jan 27-28. First of all it is under renovation so it is impossible to find the check in if you use the parking garage. You have to walk miles and try to follow the signs and not use the wrong elevator. Once we checked in we treked miles back to the otherside of the hotel, tried to get in the right elevator as one of them is only for the construction help. Once we found our room the key wouldn't work. Sooo back the other way to the front desk to get new keys. Once in our room it is much out dated! Carpet was torn, bath fixtures were loose, furniture all beat up, and outdated 25" TV. The beds were hard and uncomfortable. The resturant was closed for renovation, so you had to drive somewhere to find some breakfast. It is attached to the mall where you can go for lunch or dinner. The catering served dry overcooked chicken for our conference luncheon. The staff was always friendly. Granted it is under renovation. I hope it emerges as a hotel you would expect from Sheraton. But till then stay away. There are much better choices close by.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid this hotel until the renovations are complete.”
Reviews.Author: cmonster78
Reviews.Content: This hotel is being renovated and is an utter cluster[--]. Unless you like navigating a construction zone and falling asleep to the fumes of paint still drying in the room next door, pick a different hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: adougla2
Reviews.Content: This hotel was great. The room was a suite that had new furnishings and was very spacious. The check-in process was very smooth and the employees were very friendly! It was a good location to get to the mall and other things in the area. It was a bit far from the airport though.

Reviews.Title: “Dont bother until they complete the renovation”
Reviews.Author: seanyg
Reviews.Content: I had the misfortune of staying at the Sheraton Indianapolis Hotel and Suites in late November 2010. Whilst the hotel may be 'under renovation', it is in extremely poor repair, the rooms are dirty and the facilities are poor. It was also too much effort for the front desk to book me an early morning cab the night before an early flight. This is by far the worse Sheraton I have ever stayed in and its only redeeming feature is its vicinity to the shopping mall.

Reviews.Title: “absolutely disgusting - stay away until reno is finished”
Reviews.Author: hbgirl
Reviews.Content: I am so disappointed in priceline - so much so, I don't know if I'll ever use them again. I put in my criteria of 3.5 stars and ended up with this dump. and dump is actually a kind word. not to mention that I severely overpaid - my bid of $135/nt was accepted (which was over what every other site was quoting), I would have a difficult time paying $40/nt for this hotel. I arrived very late and had requested a quiet room - I was sent to the far end of the hotel, the room door had some kind of stains on it (looked like blood? ketchup? just gross). I opened the door and there were more smeared stains on the walls, the wallpaper was peeling off, the carpet looked like it hadn't been replaced since 1975. the bathroom was ridiculously small. I called the front desk and was "upgraded" to a jr. suite - although a million times better than the last room (hooray - no stains!), it still had the peeling wallpaper and gross carpet. I didn't want to touch anything for fear I'd get some kind of disease. I know the hotel is going through a massive renovation, but really? it can't be that difficult to touch it up - it honestly looked like nothing had been done in a good 20 years. stay far away until the hotel is finished - after that, I'm sure it will be very nice. the one positive is that it's directly attached to a mall so I could just walk to shopping/restaurants. but that still doesn't make up for the disgusting room(s).

Reviews.Title: “Seriously unimpressive . . . and I'm usually fairly easy to please”
Reviews.Author: kwa829
Reviews.Content: I was disappointed in this property. If you read other tripadvisor reviews I have submitted, you see I tend to be fairly positive and easy-to-please, so my review is NOT the case of some overly picky nitpicker who gives 1 star because the shampoo is not to their liking. * The public areas looked very dated and worn. * The elevators resembled freight elevators, with abundant scratches and dents all over the woodwork and railings. * Carpeting in the hallways and elevators in atrocious condition, not unlike a carpeted subway car. * The lower levels present an utterly confusing maze , inclusive of a massive amount of convention and conference space (through which one must navigate from parking garage to registration, and again from registration to room) laid out in strange triangular patterns - i.e., hallways not at right angles - that causes one to utterly lose one's sense of place and direction. There are maps posted, but they do NOT have "you are here" indicators and it was impossible to tell how the maps were oriented vis-a-vis the direction I was looking. I'm a pretty good navigator with a pretty good "internal sense of direction", and I was baffled. * It took me about 15 minutes to locate my room. I was unaware that there were multiple "towers". There is no signage that directs guests from registration to their tower by room number. One of the tower elevator banks indicated something like "rooms 250-1299" (or something like that); I had room 503 (or whatever it was). 503 is between 250 and 1299, but this was the wrong tower. I guess one of the towers must have been for rooms with last two digits 50 or higher. Management, could you make this more clear? * The first time I left my room to go downstairs, I got on the elevator and pushed "1". The elevator went down to 1 and then did not open (Later I was able to surmise that this may have been due to construction on "1"). I then realized that you have to go to "2" to get out (and then subsequently go down to 1 by means of a stairway or separate elevator bank). But it is somewhat disconcerting to have an elevator door not open as expected. You'd think they could put up a sign to this effect and disable the "1" button. * The remote control for my TV was completely dead. After I called the front desk, it took 45 minutes for someone to deliver a replacement (perhaps they could have told me it would take 45 minutes, but invite me to come down to the desk myself if I wanted it sooner). On the plus side: * Once I was in the room, I found the room to be fairly decent . . . fresh clean bedding and linens, spacious bathroom, comfortable bed. * The in-room internet conection ($9.95 per day) is NOT wireless, but they supply the ethernet cable and was actually a fairly good, fast connection by hotel standards. * Other than the worn carpeting and dings and dents everywhere, the hotel did NOT seem "dirty" . . . i.e., no dust, no gross stains. IN other words, the poor condition was of a physical, not sanitary nature. * The hotel is connected by indoor passageway to a sizable adjacent shopping mall, providing a nice climate-controlled, safe means of getting out for a little evening leg-stretching. * The hotel provides free parking. * There is a fitness center (but it will take some work to find it as there is no directional signage leading to it). It's actually fairly decent, though it seems to be "improvised", being located in a nondescript convention room.

Reviews.Title: “High Class”
Reviews.Author: missysbaskets
Reviews.Content: This hotel was easy to find using the gps, parking garage was well lit, the staff was very thoughtful of my son's first stay in a hotel. They allowed us to stay an additional few hours and swim in the pool. The only negative was that the housekeeping did not understand a single word of english and tried to argue with us about staying "too long" however the front desk had approved the extended stay already. The mall attached to the hotel was equally as high class as the hotel itself. I would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay for the Price!”
Reviews.Author: Jables460
Reviews.Content: Booked the room as part of a wedding booking, and used a 3rd party booking site, saved some money over the wedding rate. Upon arrival, we learned that we had been upgraded to a King Suite as part of the wedding booking. This was a double bonus based on what we paid. The room was clean. The bed was comfortable. Starbucks coffee for the in-room coffee maker was a treat. Is it bad that I judge a hotel based on the coffee they offer me for my wake-up?? The location is excellent as well for shopping and dining out. Moved downtown the following night to a 4-star hotel and was severely disappointed. We missed our suite at the Sheraton!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: cobalt222
Reviews.Content: Had to stay here because first preference was booked. Wireless is poor if you can connect! Outdated rooms with outdated furnishings. Thin walls so light sleepers beware. Do I need to say more? I would have expected more from Sheraton!

Reviews.Title: “Great get away for two!”
Reviews.Author: jp_edwards
Reviews.Content: We had a great time and never had to get out in the cold. Dinner, shopping and movies all connected to the hotel. Everything was clean and the whole staff seemed to really love what they do. Five stars from this traveler.

Reviews.Title: “Location Excellent; Hotel Terrible”
Reviews.Author: Nupe4Life
Reviews.Content: This hotel is desperately in need of a makeover. It is extremely outdated and doesn't belong in the area that it represents. My family spent the last 3 days at this hotel and after our visit will never stay at another Sheraton property unless it is new. We were very disappointed. If we weren't a part of a group for our family reunion we definitely would have relocated to another hotel. It was a disaster from the moment we walked into our first room and downhill from there. The first room that we had was full of gnats as well as terribly worn carpeting and furniture. The bathroom toilet didn't have a handle on it and the toilet was dirty. These issues were immediately corrected so I must give them credit for this. We attempted to stay in this room even going to the local store to buy some Raid to get rid of the bugs. After spraying the room and leaving for a few hours upon our return the gnats had gotten worse. We finally had to get another room. The next room was better however the carpeting and furniture was worn. The bathroom was not clean and when we pulled out the sleeper couch the comforter was extremely soiled. The bathroom sink developed a slow drain towards the end of our stay and we began to see gnats in this room as well. I did see a hole in the roof near the sprinkler head - this may be the culprit for the gnats. During the first night of sleeping the air conditioning system made loud clanging noises and a high pitched hissing sound. We had to turn the system off in the main bedroom for the remainder of our stay so that we could get a good night's sleep. Fortunately it was cool enough outside during our visit that we didn't really need the air. Another one of our reunion participants had to change their room due to water leaking from the floor above into their shower. This water actually got onto the guest as she was showering. They were moved o another room as well. In the lobby they had a section showing their impending renovations - this can't happen soon enough. Until the renovations happen, I wouldn't recommend this hotel to my worse enemy. I must say however the front desk supervisor was very polite and helpful in trying to resolve issues. She didn't offer a discount on the rooms or any type of voucher for all of the inconveniencies. The best thing about this hotel is the free parking!!!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice 5 nights. Did I stay in the same hotel as the other reviewers?”
Reviews.Author: DonCarlos
Reviews.Content: I spent five nights at this hotel from Sept. 22-27 as a guest of Roche Diagnostics while in training for a new lab instrument. As always, before I go anywhere I review the Hotel / Resort because I don't like surprises. Let me clarify that, I don't like BAD surprises and that's what I expected after reading all of the previous reviews. I must say that this hotel exceeded my expectations in every category. I had a suite on the 5th floor facing the Fashion Mall. The room was restocked and cleaned every day and everything was in perfect working order. There was plenty of hot water when I needed it, with plenty of water pressure. The bed was very comfortable having a thick quilted mattress cover and a thick but not too heavy comforter. Bedding was crisp and clean. TV selections, at least for me, left something to be desired, but with the extracurricular activities scheduled by Roche, and spending time with colleagues it really didn't matter much. FOOD: The food at the Sheraton was very good. The breakfast buffet had fresh fruit, eggs, breakfast meats, potatoes and pancakes. I enjoyed a hearty breakfast every morning with a couple of really good cups of coffee. I also had dinner at the lobby bar two nights and ordered room service the another two nights. Some of the items I really enjoyed were the fried calamari, Cobb salad with ahi tuna and grilled shrimp, various types of sliders, an excellent burger and a very nice New York strip steaks perfectly cooked. Some of these items were room service including the steak and all arrived in less than 20 min. and all were fresh and hot. STAFF: Everyone at the hotel was friendly and helpful. The front desk was efficient and was able to make my stay trouble free. Restaurant personnel were attentive and very polite and bent over backwards to grant your requests. At this point I need to mention two of the restaurant staff who deserve a pat on the back. First there was Chelsea in the lobby bar who made me feel at home my first night, with suggestions from the menu and Krissy who was our server during our Roche sponsored evening get together dinner. All of the nice Latina waitresses who delivered room service were efficient and polite and never failed to ask if there was any thing that needed attention. The hotel is attached to the Fashion Mall at Keystone Crossing in case you need something during your stay. There are several restaurants in the mall. Roche treated us to a dinner at Maggiano's Little Italy, where we enjoyed a family style Italian dinner. I must thank my host, Roche Diagnostics for making the training session and the stay in Indy as pleasant as it could be. Hello to the c311 instructors, Todd, Lori and Lauren, thanks for everything. To sum up my review, I have to say I was pleasantly pleased by the Sheraton and would not hesitate to return. Sincerely, Chuck Nuernberger

Reviews.Title: “Unacceptable”
Reviews.Author: biztravelerChicago
Reviews.Content: Nice lobby. Too bad you're not staying there. You're staying in one of the rooms down that hallway with the gouged walls and filthy carpeting. Your room features dirty carpeting, mildewed tub grout, scratched up furniture and a rock-hard bed. There are many good hotels in Indy. This is definitely not one of them. They say they're remodeling. That's at least ten years overdue, but may be worth a try then.

Reviews.Title: “the worst hotel ever”
Reviews.Author: protravel27
Reviews.Content: rude,rude,rude should sum it up tubs dont drain ,took shower in 4 inches water valet was very gangster rachel miller the worst front desk supervisor ,very stuck up

Reviews.Title: “Unpleasant room”
Reviews.Author: compost4all
Reviews.Content: We were upgraded to Club Level. There was no club. The room smelled of chlorine. On a warm, very humid day the room climate was either cold and clammy or warm and damp. Neither was acceptable. The lobby area was very nice, and bar attendant welcoming and helpful. The location in a larger commercial and shopping mall was helpful if that's where you want to be. While parking is free, internet service is $10 a day. We checked in at noon, had a lunch and shower. I went to a late afternoon wedding while my wife stayed in the room. Because of the unpleasant room environment we checked out at 6:30, and drove three hours back home. Room booked through Hotwire. No refunds - no changes. The hotel's three+ star level was probably correct when new. Now the hotel is pretty well dated. It's a basic conference hotel.

Reviews.Title: “I am not sure why this hotel has unfavorable reviews!”
Reviews.Author: S_Belle2010
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went through Priceline to reserve this hotel. We placed a bid, so we were not able to choose our hotel. After we found out that the Sheraton had accepted our bid, we immediately went to Trip Advisor to look at the reviews. I am not sure why this hotel has such unfavorable reviews. We had a great stay! Check in was a breeze. The entire staff was very friendly and helpful. There were several banquets and reunions going on during our stay, but we were not bothered by the noise or crowds. There was ample parking as well. I am a very light sleeper and did not hear any noise, which is very rare for any hotel! The only complaint that I have would be that the elevators were slow. Several reviews stated that the hotel is dated. It does show slight wear in places, but nothing bad. This was a very clean and comfortable hotel and I would recommend it to my own family and definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Love the location”
Reviews.Author: tyted777
Reviews.Content: I stay here often. It is a great location. It is attached to the Fashion Mall.It is close to fairground,Castleton mall,and many popular places. It is centralized in the city. My only complaint is it needs updated. I have been visiting here for the last decade and it remains the same. The beds are worn and uncomfortable. the suite tower is better than the regular tower.The pool needs remodeled. I am loyal to this hotel but please consider a makeover!

Reviews.Title: “older but still decent”
Reviews.Author: oggette222
Reviews.Content: I have attended an annual professional convention at this hotel for the better part of the last 15 years. I have stayed in the regular rooms and the suites over the years. I took a room this year for the first time in 3 years. I was hesitant after reading some of the more recent reviews, but knew this was my best option for attending my meetings. The hotel seems to be in need of updating, but I found most everything to be in decent condition and generally satisfactory. There were holes, like burn holes, in my comforter, the light in the bath seems to need a new ballast, one of the two locks on my window needed repair, but there were no unpleasant odors and everything was clean. There seem to be plans for this property to be updated, according to the in-house TV channel. I did not use the pool this year. I was given the option to go "green" and use no housekeeping or limited housekeeping instead of traditional housekeeping. I chose to use no housekeeping during my two night stay and was given a $5 food/drink voucher for my efforts. It was a nice touch. There were enough in-room coffee supplies for my stay already in my room, as well as towels, so I felt comfortable with that option. There were friendly desk staff- smiling, but a little "short" in personal interaction. Almost as if limited to a script..... however I did share an elevator with an EXCEEDINGLY polite and friendly Bellman, just wish I could have caught his name. The catering staff and AV staff who were assigned to our convention were effective, but a little wooden in their demeanor..... As always, the free parking is nice. The hotel is connected to the Fashion Mall, including their food court/restaurants. Many restaurants are within walking distance in nicer weather. Nice mix of stores in the mall. A little updating and this could be a real gem in the Indy hotel scene.

Reviews.Title: “Great Locaution but need to be updated”
Reviews.Author: Hamilo
Reviews.Content: I went there with my sister and the two dogs. We liked the fact that they allowed dogs. Decent size of room. Very comfortable. However, the room and the hotel itself was a little bit too old.

Reviews.Title: “I am glad I used my Starpoints instead of cash”
Reviews.Author: onceandawhile
Reviews.Content: Some of the common spaces are nice but the pool area, elevators, and the suite that we stayed in are in dire need of attention. The room smelled like a hamper full of dirty laundry. The televisions are outdated and the words "Welcome to the Sheraton” are burned into the screens. Other issues like an extremely loud exhaust fan that came on automatically every time someone went into the bathroom and uncomfortable dirty furniture only added to our disappointment. We also found the restaurant and room service prices to be a bit excessive and decided to eat elsewhere. I wouldn’t say that it was a bad experience, but if you have high expectations of what a Sheraton hotel should offer, you may be let down.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Stay At The Sheraton”
Reviews.Author: Sliphorn
Reviews.Content: I had read all the dire reviews of this place but decided that we would chance it since I had enough points for a free room and that it is connected via walkway with the Keystone Fashion Mall. Upon check in (after the short walk from the free parking garage), we were immediately upgraded to a suite which was nice and roomy. The room was clean and the living room area had a bar with a refrigerator and a one-cup coffee maker with Starbucks. The elevators seemed to have sensors as at least twice as I approached them in the evening, one opened right up for me. I believe that this place has been upgraded since it was a Raddison back in the 90's and is nice and spacious. The checkout was quick and efficient and I was informed that there were no charges and therefore, no bill. Upon arrival back home I had an email showing this phantom statement with a zero balance. One other amenity is that the business center (accessed via room key) has a computer on which you can access the internet for free. This is a plus as they charge $10 daily for in room internet access.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Suprise”
Reviews.Author: Dave012468
Reviews.Content: Upon check-in, we were upgraded to a corner suite. Very nice room with 25'wide window with views toward downtown. Great location. Common areas are very upscale. Pool was large and hot tub was hot. Would go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Started out bad but ended up great...”
Reviews.Author: Giggles2871
Reviews.Content: My husband and I checked in with our two small children. I was unpacking when I noticed a used condom in the garbage! I was very suprised because we've stayed at this particular hotel quite a few times in the past and have always had a great experience. My husband immediately informed the front desk and they moved us to a suite for the same room rate and gave us a complimentary buffet breakfast (which was really nice because the bill for breakfast was $51.00)! The staff was very attentive for the rest of our stay and we didn't have anymore problems. They definitely understand customer service....

Reviews.Title: “Good location -- not updated”
Reviews.Author: carnifex1125
Reviews.Content: This Sheraton is very convenient as it is connected directly to a mall and is near several eateries. However, this hotel is very dated. The bed is incredibly hard and the entire hotel has a musty smell to it.

Reviews.Title: “If you have allergies - Beware!!”
Reviews.Author: YRHips
Reviews.Content: We had reservations for this hotel. On arrival we (as always) remind the staff that due to allergies we need a room that has been pet free. We were informed by the manager, Betsy, that they have no such rooms because animals can go into any room. They do not keep track of which rooms had an animal. This is very bad for individuals with animal dander allergy. Dander cannot be adequately cleaned away. It must deteriorate and that process takes 3 to 6 months. Betsy was kind enough to call around and find us a pet free room at a competitor hotel. She aslo called the Sheraton we were to stay in the next day (in another city) and found that they too, did not have any pet free rooms. This gave us time to find other accommodations.

Reviews.Title: “Time for a pick-me-up”
Reviews.Author: jmm2
Reviews.Content: This is basically fine hotel but desperately in need of updating. It has a very worn and tattered appearance. Walls are badly knicked, carpeting is worn, wrinkled and in some areas stained. Furniture is tired and knicked up. All that said, we had a very comfortable, very quiet stay on a very busy race weekend in Indianapolis. Staff was very helpful. The breakfast buffet in the dining room was excellent. Great location.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome service but doesn't make up for old, not so clean rooms”
Reviews.Author: tkc1073
Reviews.Content: In a great location as everyone else has stated. Great restaurants and shopping very close. Gorgeous lobby and very friendly staff. Nice indoor pool and hot tub area. Free covered parking. We stayed in a room w/ king size bed and pullout couch. I had to pay $10 a day for internet (not wireless). Everything was worn. Walls in room, bathroom and hallways just seemed like they needed to be clean. Scuffs on desk and entertainment console. Cigarette burns on the couch. Bathroom wall and ceiling had plaster repairs in numerous placed. Mirror was scuffed around the edges. Definitely needs to be remodeled but relatively clean. I called guest services for pillows, sheets and blanket as soon as we settled in. Waited about 2 hours and still didn't get them. We set up the pullout couch and found a huge stain on the mattress. After talking with the front desk, they upgraded us to "club level". The new room on club level was the same but now had free breakfast (which is WAY overpriced) and a free drink for each adult in the room each night. Our stay was ok but will not stay here when we return to Indy next year. I really appreciated the attentiveness of the staff but it just didn't make up for the rest.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay with great location!!”
Reviews.Author: erlamimi
Reviews.Content: This is the third time I've stayed here and I always love it. One of the best features of this hotel is that it is attached to the Fashion Mall and you don't have to walk outside which was great when it was raining out. There are also some fabulous restaurants in walking distance - Cheesecake Factory, PF Changs, Maggianos to name a few. I wouldn't think twice about staying here again!!

Reviews.Title: “No fridge, fee internet, eh...”
Reviews.Author: cmmccla
Reviews.Content: I was here on a business trip and the hotel is large and attached to an upscale mall which was great. Location: Excellent. The Cheesecake Factory attached to the mall, which was attached to the hotel made it all ok. The hotel is large so it took me 5 minutes to get to my room on the 8th floor. Long hallway to room. Room: Average room, no refridgerator...sigh... I really hate that. My coworker who reserved the room at the same time as me was upgraded to their Tower Suite section which was newer and nicer. WITH refrigerator and separate living room. Same price. Hmph. My room was average. Bathroom was clean. Everything was decent. Internet is $9.95, good thing I have the wireless card. Overall, it was a nice hotel but the details were lacking. Thank goodness I paid business rate. It probably used to be super nice but has aged. It is a nice, decent hotel but nothing to brag about. I'd recommend it based on attachment to mall and restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Gone to the dumps!”
Reviews.Author: dentalgal
Reviews.Content: This is the 3rd time I have attended a convention at this Sheraton in the past 10 years. I always look forward to it for the great beds, suites and comfort. WELL I got a real surprise and shocker when we checked in! It is in TERRIBLE, and I MEAN TERRIBLE, disrepair! We got checked in, went to the 3rd floor and when we got off the elevator, there were ceiling tiles missing, debris had fallen on the carpet, the hallway carpet was stained, cut and rolled in places. There were lightbulbs leaning up on the doors and no one changing them. It smelled badly.. of mildew! So keeping an open mind, we walked into our room and it was like a blast of hot fire. The "air" was stuck on 87 degrees... we played with the thermostat to no avail. We called the front desk, they sent a staff person with a key to a new room next door. We walked in and it smelled so badly of mildew, he quickly escorted us out to the third room next door... the walls has sticky "debris" on them, it stunk and we were outta there! So he called down and we were promptly "upgraded" to the suite tower. Well this was not a lot better, but it was liveable. The furniture is badly beat up, the refrigerator had leaked all over the carpet and it was soaked and the room just plain STUNK. It was a cross between smoke ( this is supposed to be a non smoking hotel), mildew and dirt. I am sorry to say that this hotel has an apparent lack of TLC. It is a shame as it is a super location ( attached to the Keystone Fashion Mall) and was a gem of a hotel in it's prime. On a good note, the convention food was great and the staff did their best to deal with these issues. They were accomodating and did their best to help us out. I won't be staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Yuck!”
Reviews.Author: NSNIndiana
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel thru Hotwire, and earlier that afternoon, so didn't know which 4 star hotel we would get, but having lived in Indy before, we were familiar with the area. The check in process was fine, and the man at the front desk was fairly cordial. Unfortunately, when we got into our room, we noticed that the furniture was badly scratched, dented, beat up. There were no chairs in the room. When I called downstairs, the person was surprised, and said she would have someone bring some furntiure up. We left to go to dinner and notified the front desk, on the way out, that the carpet looked filthy and was horribly stained. The woman acted like she had no idea why I would tell her this information. I was hoping after two complaints, although I was very nice about it, that they would put us in a different room, but not so much. I complained to Hotwire folks, who refunded our money and tried to find us another place. It was too late at night and we decided to just drive the three hours on home. When we went to pick up our luggage and check out, after dinner, my husband noted that the staff had brought up two folding chairs to the room and left them inside the door. We couldn't believe that a Sheraton would be like this. We don't routinely stay at Sheraton and in fact, I've not stayed in one since the 80's in London, but we were very disappointed. Even the furniture in the hallways, carpet, wallpaper, etc. was frayed, worn and stained. The worst was they absolutely didn't seem to really care that much. Maybe they were used to getting complaints. I certainly won't stay there again, and I will let everyone I know about it. We've never used Hotwire before but they really tried to be helpful and I will probably try them again at some point. You'd think with the Sheraton name, last minute reservation or not, you'd have a better result than that.

Reviews.Title: “Won't Return”
Reviews.Author: MTParticular2008
Reviews.Content: I am MTParticular for a reason! I did not choose this hotel - it was chosen for me by the conference committee - I will not return, even if I must miss the conference next year! The location is nice - clean, safe suburban area of Indianapolis. I reserved a car service for transportation since it was work travel and I did not want to rent a car on district business - 40minutes from the airport/$42.00 roundtrip (Above and Beyond car service). We (a collegue traveled with me) arrived at the hotel - great lobby! I entered the FIRST room, there was clean, standing water in the tub!!!! Oh, no!!! I went to the front desk, explained the situation and was given another room. The SECOND room, no standing water...YET! The hotel is an older building - the lobby has received upgrades as well as the restaurant/bar area - NOT the rooms! It's not a dump...but close. NO room upgrades - stained carpet, stained sofa, stained curtains...dingy. The bathroom was an acceptable size...but very old - and the standing water appeared when I took a shower...several inches high!!!!!! UNACCEPTABLE!!! The first night, I tried to "suck it up and take it like a champ" - the second night, the slow flush, standing water in the tub...too much to suck up! I spoke to the General Manager...he lacked appropriate interpersonal communication skills - HOWEVER, he was responsive to my concerns as he sent maintenance to the room. I return to the room after dinner to notice the tip that I left for housekeeping was gone...the room was not cleaned...but there was evidence that maintenance had been in the room because the MONEY was gone, the toliet seat cover was down, and the bath mat on the floor was dirty with shoe prints!!!! AND, long hair, that was NOT MINE, was in the toilet!!!!!!!! WOW!!!!! Furious, I went back to the General Manager and he referred me to the Room Manager/Director, Andy. Andy exhibited the appropriate communication skills and was very apologetic. After taking a walk, I returned to the room which had been cleaned by Houskeeping and the drain problems in the tub/toilet were repaired. Room service delivered a tray with fresh fruit, snacks, and bottled water - a personal note of apology from Andy... Andy called me to offer points for a 1 night stay at a Starwood hotel. Of course, Andy did a phenominal job to redeem this Sheraton location and I sincerely appreciated his commendable effort. However, I will not return. The fact still remains that the hotel rooms are in substandard condition. Great job Andy...poor performance Sheraton! The hotel is connected to a fashion mall (with a small movie theater and foodcourt) with the anchor stores Nordstrom and Saks...restaurants are close and in walking distrance. However, NO CVS/Walgreens/Wal-Mart-type stores are in walking distance...bring EVERYTHING with you!!! An option: There is a Marriott in walking distance and again, based on the lobby, it looks great. We visited the Marriott restaurant/patio - nice view of a small lake. Great walking trail around the lake that connects the Marriott to office building, a very nice residential community and Champps Resturant (by the way, a great Champps location with an outside deck and live entertainment...at least on Wednesday nights). On one occasion, there was a gentleman and young lady in the Sheraton elevator commiserating about their Sheraton experince - both "regular business travelers" to the Keystone Crossing area but not traveling together - when I asked, they BOTH agreed that the Mariott was much better than the Sheraton. I hope this helps!

Reviews.Title: “The good, the bad, and the ugly”
Reviews.Author: idclaire
Reviews.Content: First the good. We were seeing a concert in nearby Noblesville. All of the hotels in Noblesville, Fishers, etc were booked (as they normally are when there is a concert going on at the Verizon Music Theater). This hotel is in a really nice area. It has a very nice parking garage which is easily accessible and FREE. Yes, I said FREE. We felt safe as well. The area of town where the hotel was situated made it easy to get to Noblesville, so that was a big PLUS. No traffic and very easy to get there coming from this direction. It also had a nice lounge where you can chill out in the lobby. Also had a dining area which we did not go to. But the lounge was nice and we enjoyed having a couple of beers there. The front desk people were very nice and polite. The lobby was spacious and beautiful. There is an indoor walkway that takes you to the Fashion Mall which houses tons of stores. I did not go there, but they have stores such as Crate & Barrell, Coldwater Creek, Sacs 5th Avenue, and more. The bad....there is not any eating establishments right in that area (within walking distance). There is a Mexican restaurant that is not far. There's also a TGIFridays and an Italian restaurant fairly close. We chose to go down Route 69 a little ways where we found Scotty's Brewhouse. It had an awesome atmosphere, friendly waitstaff, reasonably priced and great food. T.V.s are at each table which was totally awesome! The rooms in the hotel were clean for the most part. The carpet needs upgraded, as they were terribly stained with God only knows what. They were a dark striped carpet and were pretty worn. The beds looked crisp and clean, but the next morning, we noticed there was some gooky stuff on the side of the bottom sheet on both beds. Looked like sticky yellow stuff. We left a note for the maid service to replace the linens and they did. After inspection, the second set appeared spotless, crisp, and clean. The tables and such are a little outdated but were clean. You cannot connect to wireless internet, and they charge $9.95 per day to connect to internet in the room. I am glad that I went through Hotwire as the rooms on the Sheratin website were $159.00 per night. Got them for $79.00 per nite on Hotwire which was quite a savings. All in all, it was not a horrible experience (as we have had some in the past). Just think that if they offered internet, and upgraded their carpets, it would be a much nicer experience.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: thankyou8600
Reviews.Content: Nice staff. Nice room. I was pleased with all aspects of my stay. Happy to recommend.

Reviews.Title: “I can't believe this stay cost me money!!”
Reviews.Author: melontwist
