Reviews.Content: I saved up for this weekend because the Sheraon is not normally somewhere I could afford to stay. The room was small and smelled musty. I called for blankets and 3 hours later received them. I had to call 3 times and my kids were crying. It was midnight when we got them. There was a volleyball convention going on during this time. Middle Schooler's were running around leaving cupcakes and twizzlers smashed into the carpet. There was broken beer bottles in the elevators. I took my kids swimming but had to leave. Kids were throwing tables and chairs into the pool. I called the front desk and they assured me security was on their way to help...no help came. I had to pull my kids out. For such a hefty price tag I CAN"T believe how horrible it was. The only good thing was being connected to the Fashion Mall. The location is wonderful. They did compenstate me with a free night.......guess where...the same hotel!! NO THANK YOU! They said I could use it at antoher Sheraton location, that was nice of them. Personally I am scared to stay at another one after this!

Reviews.Title: “Would stay here again”
Reviews.Author: liannenc
Reviews.Content: This is very nicely located adjacent to a shopping mall which I would consider "high end" My company held a training seminar here and I stayed 2 nights. Unfortunately, for some reason the mall closed at 8:00 PM during February, so by the time my colleagues and I got out of our meetings and had supper, all of the stores in the mall were closed. The mall looked lovely, but it wasn't as much of a diversion as we had hoped. However, the rooms we were in were very nice-- nice, comfy beds and clean rooms. The amenities in the bathroom were especially nice ("Bliss" brand products). The meeting facilities were alright, but the temp in the room was difficult to control so we had to open the doors out to the hallway... however, the "muzak" playing out there was rather loud and distracting. The catering staff was very nice, however, and the lunches which were catered were fine. Breakfasts were pretty skimpy, but then I'm not really a fan of "Continental" breakfasts like that. The bar in the hotel is just off the lobby area and was just okay. It was pretty small and "exposed" (not closed off at all from the lobby) and, as a woman, I wouldn't have been very comfortable going there by myself in the evening as there were very few women there. I went with my colleagues, though, and it was fine... just a personal thing, I guess. However, one evening a group of us went there and several bought drinks. Another colleague joined us and tried to bring a cup of coffee he had just bought at Starbucks (in the mall) but the bartender was downright nasty about it and wouldn't let him bring it in. I could understand that if the bar served coffee drinks (as far as I could tell they did not) or if he was by himself, but our group bought quite a few drinks so no one could argue that they were losing money on us. Other staff were fine, friendly and very helpful... just this one bartender sucked. There are a number of restaurants close to this hotel (Cheesecake Factory is INSIDE the attached mall) but it was too cold and snowy while we were there to venture outside the hotel & mall. In nicer weather, though, we could have walked to a number of different places offering all kinds of cuisine. If I had to go to Indy again on business, I wouldn't hesitate to stay here but I would hope that the mall would be open more normal hours!

Reviews.Title: “A Dump!”
Reviews.Author: global1K
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at many Sheratons and they are usually very nice. The location of this hotel is great - on the northside of Indy, attached to one of the city's high end malls. I had to stay at this hotel for 4 nights and it was bad. The hotel was supposedly full on the Suites side - which may be better. However, the rooms on the North wing of the hotel are dreary, worn, and questionably clean. The furniture looked as though it had been through a hurricane and the coffee table that was supposed to be in front of the couch was gone. The bathroom wallpaper was a mess. The hallways were dark and the walls scuffed. I am extremely disappointed and will never stay at this hotel again. I often get online requests from Sheraton for feedback about their hotels after my stay - nothing after my stay at this one - I didn't even see a comment card in my hotel room. I suspect they know the place is bad - it needs a major overhaul.

Reviews.Title: “great bed”
Reviews.Author: NAVACA
Reviews.Content: We got a great rate online and decided to try this hotel. The bed and linens were comfortable. It was clean they were very courteous. Upon check-in they upgraded us to a suite. Room service was quick, but of course it's overpriced. I also liked the fact it had free parking garage attached. Great location, I wish I had another night to stay, because the hotel was attached to a great mall. Overall, I got a good night's sleep (which is the most important to me) the room was clean. I would definitely stay again if we come back to Indianapolis.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but pricey!”
Reviews.Author: hoosiermama81
Reviews.Content: The beds were so soft, I wanted to load one up & take it home. The room was clean and well maintained. The view was nice. I also really dug the pool. I liked how the light shined in through the windows & reflected off the water. My big negative was that the hot tub was not working (even though I was assured it would be) & that they have closed off the sauna. You have to go to Bally's to use it & you have to pay :(

Reviews.Title: “Where do I start”
Reviews.Author: relaxdude
Reviews.Content: I had the chance to stay there during the National FFA Convention. At check in I asked for a comp of internet service since I could keep an eye on my students better from my room. They said no and that they were in the "business" to make money (my business is going elsewhere) 164 dollars a night (cheaper on the internet) $2,500 total bill and would not give me $30 worth of internet. The pool boy threw away our clothes and hour before the pool closed. I had to park my bus 2 blocks away even though they had a surface lot behind the motel. They got grumpy if you loaded your bus in front of the motel. The bed comforter was heavy like lying under a lead blanket couch was worn out food prices were way high I hope to never stay there again because I have been treated better in a nicer place for half the price.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay, good location”
Reviews.Author: blueiii
Reviews.Content: My husband stayed at the Sheraton in connection with a conference he was attending. I came for the last night since it was our anniversary. The Sheraton is located at Keystone Crossing, so if you want a hotel within walking distance (or a very short drive) of a lot of shopping - this is a good place to stay. The rooms are nice, spacious, and appointed well enough for the price you pay (although keep in mind we paid the state rate). The bed had nice linens but was rather hard. We had a bit of trouble with the room thermostat, but it didn't compromise our stay. There were a huge number of youth hockey players staying at the hotel that night and while we didn't have problems with them making noise in the hallway (because my husband yelled at them), we heard others at the conference were kept awake until 3:00 a.m. even after calling the front desk to have someone deal with the kids. Hard to blame the hotel entirely however when the parents of these kids were totally clueless. Overall a decent stay for the price. I'd probably feel differently if I'd paid full price!

Reviews.Title: “Very, very, very poor”
Reviews.Author: Rodsussexuk
Reviews.Content: I had the misfortune to stay at this hotel for four days on business. From the dark and dingy hallways with their scuffed wallpaper to the bathrooms with badly patched wallpaper and unbelievably bad ceiling repairs, it is dire. The bedrooms are a good size but it looks as thought the last guest just left and made the bed - badly. The staff are almost universally unsmiling and unhelpful. I guess the only good thing is that you are very close to restaurants - they are within walking distance and are almost certainly going to e better than the room service! The hotel is also connected directly to the shopping mall if thats your thing. I hope never to stay there again but I am at the mercy of my clients!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced”
Reviews.Author: tcsparks
Reviews.Content: Careful, you get charged for paper and bottled water. Breakfast was good, view was nice, and bed was comfortable. It just seemed overpriced for me.

Reviews.Title: “Where's the sign?”
Reviews.Author: klittrell
Reviews.Content: Since the Hyatt Place was overbooked we were upgraded to a suite at the Sheraton. Nice hotel but when I complained that the hot tub wasn't working and wanted a free pass to bally's to use it there(a $5.00 charge). The manger asked me if I asked the front desk when I checked in, if the hot tub was working and would not satisfy my request. My response was that unless there was a sign at the front desk telling clients that the amenity wasn't working one would assume it was. Furniture definitely showing its wear and tear. Ms. Coyle certainly did not offer me the service I expected from this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Not good”
Reviews.Author: unhappycamper101
Reviews.Content: Well, you know it's not good when there are Marion County sherrifs patrolling the halls. TOTALLY understaffed. Children from soccer and baseball teams ran wild, messed up elevators and pulled the fire alarm. Yes, parents weren't supervising, but the hotel needed to deal with the situation. Ice machine broken on several floors. I was there for a conference, and across the board attendees were totally dissatisfied with the hotel, ammenities, service, value etc. No concierge to call a cab etc. Stay downtown at any of the other hotels...much better value!

Reviews.Title: “Needs an updating”
Reviews.Author: 2toots
Reviews.Content: This is a hotel and conference center comprised of 2 sections-- 1 being rooms, which include the Club Level and the other being Suites(the newer section). The suite section and the room section are seperated by the restuarant. You have to walk through the 'foyer' to get to the suite elevator, and be aware...since it is a conference center, most times the foyer is busy with buffett luncheons and evening company receptions. It is a 12 story hotel. Views are either of a lake/apartment complex or the mall, parking lot and stores. Our view was the mall. We booked a corner suite. Bedroom and Living room walls are all glass--great for a panaramoic view, but again, our view wasn't anything great. We did see the Indianpolis Skyline in the distance! The suites are just under 600 square feet, more than enough room for 2 people. 2 closets, 2 tv's, bathroom, wet bar, large desk, and sofa complete the suite. Internet is $10/day, but in the lobby it's free--It bothers me when you go to a conference center for business and they charge for internet...we're here 4 days--and personally, $40 is a lot to pay for internet, so here I sit in the foyer using the fee wi-fi. The pool and hot tub are nothing special. They are located in the room section of the hotel--a leisurely stroll if you are staying in the Suites. $5/day for the fitness center, it's located outside the hotel at Balley's. We parked behind the hotel. It's easy to lose your bearings in this hotel, too many entrances and meandering hallways by the conference/ball roooms. The mall does have a lot of stores, a theater and a couple of food court eateries. There is no shortage of restuarants within a mile. From White Castle (a favorite of mine) to Shanghi Lil's (pricey asian food). We found the Tawaiin Tea House very affordable and look forward to going back, a spotless restaurant serving good, clean food and a great selection of brewed teas. If I had to return to the Sheraton at Keystone Crossing, I would think twice about it. There is a Marriott very close to it and also a suite type of hotel (Homewood, extended-stay-residence- Inn, can't remember) Advice, it'll cost more, but stay in a suite. You may be able to pay $25 for access to the Club lounge--I got 2 different answers, one yes, and one no from the front desk when I asked if I could pay to access the lounge. 100% in agreement with others, this place needs a lot of TLC. I tried to take a photo of the tv area that's in disrepair. Also, the closets surrounding the fridge don't open. Bottled water is around $3.50

Reviews.Title: “Needs a huge update!”
Reviews.Author: beachbum48
Reviews.Content: 1st the positives - Free parking garage, health club accessability Now the negatives - The bed was like sleeping on the sidewalk, the room was nice about 5 years ago- wall paper torn in the bathroom and hallways, the ice machine did not work on our floor, for a non smoking room it sure smelled a lot like someone had been smoking in it. The walls were paper thin. We heard everything in all the rooms around us and above us. For the price it just was not worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here! Nice facade but gross rooms!”
Reviews.Author: julieg77
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this Sheraton last weekend. I'll start with the pros, great location (by the mall), the hotel staff were very friendly and the lobby is nice. Unfortunately, the cons far outweigh the pros if you consider your actual room a priority. We checked in and went to our room (King, non smoking). Immediately upon opening the door, the room reaked of smoke and dog urine. We've never done this before, but we went back down to ask for another room! (We did come to find out this hotel is now completely non-smoking, which means they recently just "turned" their smoking rooms into non-smoking ones. They are also dog-friendly). The hotel desk person was VERY nice and apologized and gave us another room on the Club Level. We figured since we needed a key to access our floor, and this was our second room, it would be nicer. Unfortunately, not the case. The room didn't smell, which was a plus, but it was just a DUMP! The wall was seperating in the bathroom, the carpet was nasty, there were stains everywhere. It just was not what I would even consider a two star room. We spent as much time as we possibly could away, so we didnt have to be in the gross room except to sleep. If this had just happened once, I'd be more forgiving, but two rooms in a row are not a good sign. I am backing this review up with photos, I just didnt want someone else to have another un-needed experience - stay somewhere else!

Reviews.Title: “Needs some updating”
Reviews.Author: blondie7197
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a night in January. The Sheraton is in a good location - attached to the Keystone mall and close to many restaurants. It's about a 15-20 minute drive to downtown. We travel with our small dog often, so we usually stay at a Starwood property. Check-in was a breeze and the staff was friendly. There was a cheerleading competition going on, so the hotel was overrun with girls and their mothers. Not exacly a peaceful atmosphere! The room was ok - a little shabby. We could smell smoke (i.e. marijuana) through the vent in the bathroom. We didn't have time to change rooms though because we were meeting friends for dinner. We left with the hopes that our dog would not be high when we returned! The bed was very uncomfortable and my husband and I were both awakened at 1:30 am to the laughing and screaming of girls. We had the breakfast buffet in the morning. It was decent but they didn't seem to restock the items and many people were getting angry. All in all it was a very average hotel. Would probably not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Too expensive”
Reviews.Author: tjtravels37
Reviews.Content: Conditions of the hotel and rooms were similar to what other patrons described.....in all, an average hotel. Would have expected better quality given the high room rate.

Reviews.Title: “Ok for price, not for urbanites”
Reviews.Author: Nicci
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on a cross-country trip; glad we were exhausted b/c too far from city/anything to reallyenjoy. Very suburban, & pretty far off the I-70 route. Pet-friendly A++++; fair & friendly about pets. Clean but very dated, older bathrooms, next to a mall (but it closes earlier than I anticipated). Close to a Ruth's Chris (which shares a parking lot with a Bob Evans & a Mc'D's - to give you some perspective). Directions on web site were wrong. Staff was VERY nice (to be expected from any SPG hotel), but felt rushed from valet & also hard parking issues - it was raining the morning of our departure & the front entrance had virtually no canopy (we were traveling X-country, needed to put my top down to load some luggage & my car got soaked; no real options to avoid this - needs some better coverage). Room service fast, friendly & fine. Again, great staff all around.

Reviews.Title: “Satisfactory for a good price”
Reviews.Author: aueander
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel one night. The room was clean and staff was friendly. I forgot a couple of toiletry items and they were happy to help out. The bed were soft and I slept well. Nothing special, but no complaints here.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but be careful how you specify your room.”
Reviews.Author: scottemc
Reviews.Content: If you stay at this property, be sure to ask for a suite, we didn't know and were stuck in the "old" side of the hotel. The beds badly need updating. Our friends were on the "suite" side and they had a nice stay. Our toilet broke several times and the lights kept burning out. The pool is rather small and loaded with kids.

Reviews.Title: “Needs Some TLC”
Reviews.Author: TLa
Reviews.Content: Stayed the night of June 29th. I must say it has really gone downhill. I saw writting on the room hallways, stained carpet in the lobby, and some staff with attitudes. My boyfriend and I stayed in a King room. The bathroom was terrible. Needs new tile desperately and the floor had coffee stains everywhere. I used to come here for conventions about 7 years ago and the place was very nice. Now, I can honestly say that it does not deserve the Sheraton name. It's a down right disgrace to the name. Management need to do something immediately.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid if possible.”
Reviews.Author: valereee
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Indianapolis Hotel & Suites for a convention in June 2007. The whole place feels in need up updating -- shabby carpets, dim hallways, scratches and dents. Just slightly shabby all-around for a Sheraton. The bed was good, though. They charge to use the wireless in the rooms, but it's free in the lobby, whch meant that the lobby and bar were often full of people with laptops in their laps. The "restaurant" is just a bare-bones open area near the lobby where they serve food. Drinks are expensive. Burger was good. Don't order the fish and chips -- the fish was inedible. Parking is free in a covered garage. If you park on level three, you can walk straight into the second level of the hotel via a covered walkway. There is a mall attached to the property by an elevated covered walkway, plus a lot of upscale chain restaurants nearby. I had to check out a day early, and they charged me $50 for this. I was appalled that any hotel -- and particularly any Sheraton -- would want to make my final impression be so negative, but maybe they figure with a hotel this shabby guests aren't likely to return anyway.

Reviews.Title: “Just a Place to Sleep”
Reviews.Author: tttaba
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for the formula weekend so we didn't spend a lot time in the hotel. The hotel seemed fairly old with out-dated decorating and wornout furniture. Although the rooms were fairly cleen there were a couple visible stains on the carpet and one of our sheets had a fairly large, dark stain on it. We had 4 people in our room and even with the airconditioner running non-stop we couldn't keep the room cool at night. The walls must be paper thin because they won't block noise from people talking or tv's from other rooms... if the person next door snores even moderately, you won't be able to sleep. On the possitive side, the hotel is in a really nice upscale area and is attached directly to mall. Also, there is free parking in an adjacent parking garage that is also attached. In general, this hotel is not a place to come to relax or do work. At best it's a place to shower and sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Easy Access to Mall, Highway & Bally's Fitness - Strangers in the Night”
Reviews.Author: Royzee
Reviews.Content: Hotel is located right in the middle of the "Fashion Mall". Free parking in adjacent garage. Free access to adjacent Bally's Fitness Center (Nice!!!) Many places to eat in Mall area: PF Chang's, Maggiano's, Mexican Grille, Sullivan's Steak, - many more (inlcuding a Marsh supermarket w/in 2 miles). Bed was comfy- everything worked in the room - everthing in my room was very clean. There is a pool area on the 2nd floor (the 2nd floor appears to be the stanked-out smoking floor). Small indoor pool and jacuzzi. towel rack but no towels. A few deck chairs scattered about an empty room. Outside on the "roof" of the 2nd floor a few tables and chaise lounges - again no towels. I was in my locked room and in bed at 11 PM when someone swiped their card key and started to come in. I yelled,"Hey!" and the person apologized and left. They had luggage, so I can only assume that the hotel had given them a key to my room. When I mentioned it to the front desk the next AM they said ,"Ooops sorry, we'll check into it." that was it . Kind of disappointing and scary.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, great staff”
Reviews.Author: BillF
Reviews.Content: This is a good hotel on the north side of Indianapolis. The check in was smooth, the room was well appointed. It was clean and quiet. Good location. Good value for the money.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: If it's Tuesday, must be Minneapolis
Reviews.Title: “Hmmm....low-end Sheraton experience”
Reviews.Author: ANDIAM0
Reviews.Content: The good: Free parking and clean, if worn, accomodations. Free access to Bally's healthclub across the street beats the "Westin Workout" for equipment. The bad: Accidentally stopped at a smoking floor. You could smell it as soon as the elevator opened. Club Lounge (12th floor) is quite bare bones. The ugly: Stains on hallway floors (10th floor) are disgusting.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MarkChicago
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sheraton because it was recommended by the Bride and Groom of a wedding we were attending while in town. We only stayed one night, but felt that the hotel was very nice. The hotel room was clean, but we were not impressed with the shower. It was definitly hard water, which is irritating when you are use to having soft water. The water pressure was fine, and it was nice to have a circle shower curtain rod, so your not always touching the curtain. One nice thing about the hotel is that is attached to a nice shopping center. You can also walk or drive over to the strip mall that is less than a block away. There is also free parking, you can pay for valet, but the parking garage is right next to the hotel and we found it very easy to get in and out. We would definilty stay here again. It is very centrally located to shopping, dining, and close to the highway. The hallways do smell like chlorine which we thought was weird because we were on the 8th floor and the pool is on the 3rd or 4th floor. We did not use the pool, but we did check it out and it looked clean. Overall, it was a very good location and very convienent.

Reviews.Title: “Do NOT stay here!!”
Reviews.Author: rsw1104
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this Sheraton in November, 2006. It was by far the dirtiest hotel room I have ever seen. My shower did not work and the cold water faucet in the sink came off in my hand. It is in need of a total renovation. The staff was nice enough, but the other guests on my floor were very loud and disruptive. They do not offer a continental breakfast. It was a horrible experience. Do not stay here!!
